puzzle.title: 49-Ring Circus
puzzle.hint: Consider the outtakes not as individual pieces but as sets of three.
The word “signaled” in the flavortext is significant
Trace the path of each trio of pieces, then use semaphore.
The solution is HOOPLA

puzzle.title: The Ring
puzzle.hint: An R is in every answer, and will thus be in the center of the grid.
The three-letter ring next to the center contains the letters A, 0, and S, in some order.
As you complete the grid, you will spell a message around the perimeter, starting at 1.

puzzle.title: Coins
puzzle.hint: The easiest place to begin is by placing the five dollar coins—there are not many places these can go.
ubtracting the dollar values from the total amounts might give you an insight about the remaining coins that must go into those rows and columns.
With the grid filled in correctly, you now have five sets of coins labeled A-E. How can you use these coins to reach this puzzle's answer?
Treat each coin as a separate connect-the-dots; draw lines from A to E for each coin.

puzzle.title: Movie Reels
puzzle.hint: Pay attention to the letters only used once in each grid.
The first letters of the first three answers in each reel are: 1) D, T, M; 2) A, L, V; 3) S, L, A; 4) M, A, G; 5) 0, I, A

puzzle.title: Pie Charts
puzzle.hint: You'll need to take the given percentage of each word.
The four sections may not add up to 100%, but they do add up to one of the images on the second page... plus a little something extra.
Bonus hint for our non-US solvers: In the states, those orange fruits are called tangerines.

puzzle.title: Dartboard (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: The first letter of the answer to "The Ring" goes with the 2.
The first letter of the answer to "Pie Charts" goes with the 5.
The first letter of the answer to "Coins" goes with the 4.
The first letter of the answer to "Movie Reels" goes with the 15.
